identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Drug Exposure in Systemic Circulation of Primatene Mist by Oral Inhalation, Versus Epinephrine Injection by Intramuscular Injection and ProAir by Oral Inhalation in Healthy Individuals
identificationModule.officialTitle: Study of Drug Exposure in Systemic Circulation of Primatene Mist (0.25mg) by Oral Inhalation, Versus Epinephrine Injection (0.30mg) by Intramuscular Injection and ProAir (0.18mg) by Oral Inhalation in Healthy Individuals: A Randomized, Safety Evaluator-blind, Three-Treatment, Crossover, Fasting Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the drug exposure profile in systemic circulation of Primatene Mist by inhalation, versus Epinephrine by intramuscular injection, and ProAir HFA by inhalation in healthy adults.

armGroups.label: Primatene Mist, E004
armGroups.description: Participants who dosed with Primatene Mist.

armGroups.label: Epinephrine Injection Auto-Injector (Generic of EpiPen)
armGroups.description: Participants who were dosed with an Epinephrine Injection Auto-Injector.

armGroups.label: Albuterol HFA
armGroups.description: Participants who dosed with Albuterol HFA.

interventions.name: Epinephrine (0.125 mg/inhalation)
interventions.description: Participants will self-administer 2 inhalations of Epinephrine (0.125 mg/inhalation) for a total dosage of 0.25 mg.

interventions.name: Epinephrine Injection Auto-Injector (0.3mg/0.3mL)
interventions.description: Participants will receive an intramuscular injection of Epinephrine via Auto-Injector (0.30 mg of epinephrine solution in 0.30 mL). The 0.30 mL dose will be given perpendicularly as a single deep intramuscular injection into the anterolateral aspect of the thigh.

interventions.name: Albuterol Sulfate (0.09 mg/inhalation)
interventions.description: Participants will self-administer 2 inhalations of Albuterol Sulfate (0.09 mg/inhalation) for a total dosage of 0.18 mg.

primaryOutcomes.measure: C[Max], Maximum Plasma Concentration of Albuterol or Epinephrine
primaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine. C\[max\] will be obtained directly from the plot of PK curve.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

primaryOutcomes.measure: AUC(0-tm)_TOT, Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Total (Exogenous and Endogenous, if Available) Active Product Ingredient (API) From Time 0 to Time (tm)
primaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine. AUC(0-tm)_TOT will be calculated with the trapezoid method. Time tm is defined as the time after C\[max\] is reached where API concentration is reduced to the levels of the same day baseline.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

primaryOutcomes.measure: AUC(0-tm)_DE, Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Exogenous Active Product Ingredient (API) From Time 0 to Time (tm)
primaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine. AUC(0-tm)_DE will be calculated with the trapezoid method. Time tm is defined as the time after C\[max\] is reached where API concentration is reduced to the levels of the same day baseline.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

primaryOutcomes.measure: AUC(0-inf), Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Albuterol or Epinephrine From Time 0 to Infinity
primaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine. AUC(0-inf) will be calculated with the extrapolation method.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: t[Max], Time at Which Maximum Plasma Concentration of Albuterol or Epinephrine is Observed
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine. t\[max\] will be obtained directly from the plot of PK curve when the maximum concentration is observed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: t[1/2], Terminal Elimination Half-life of Albuterol or Epinephrine
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Access to patient level data and supporting clinical documents may be requested by qualified researchers. Requests will be reviewed on the basis of scientific merit. Patient data will be de-identified to protect the privacy of trial patients in line with applicable laws and regulations.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Participants were randomized to receive all 3 treatments over 3 treatment periods in a crossover design.

groups.title: A-B-C
groups.description: Subjects received one of the three treatments during each study visit. Visit 1: Treatment A: Two (2) inhalations of Primatene Mist (0.125 mg of epinephrine per inhalation), for a total dosage of 0.25 mg; Visit 2: Treatment B: Intramuscular injection of Epinephrine via Auto-Injector (0.30 mg of epinephrine solution in 0.30 mL), for a total dosage of 0.30 mg; Visit 3: Treatment C: Two (2) inhalations of Albuterol HFA (0.09 mg of albuterol sulfate per inhalation), for a total dosage of 0.18 mg.

groups.title: B-C-A
groups.description: Subjects received one of the three treatments during each study visit. Visit 1: Treatment B: Intramuscular injection of Epinephrine via Auto-Injector (0.30 mg of epinephrine solution in 0.30 mL), for a total dosage of 0.30 mg; Visit 2: Treatment C: Two (2) inhalations of Albuterol HFA (0.09 mg of albuterol sulfate per inhalation), for a total dosage of 0.18 mg; Visit 3: Treatment A: Two (2) inhalations of Primatene Mist (0.125 mg of epinephrine per inhalation), for a total dosage of 0.25 mg.

groups.title: C-A-B
groups.description: Subjects received one of the three treatments during each study visit. Visit 1: Treatment C: Two (2) inhalations of Albuterol HFA (0.09 mg of albuterol sulfate per inhalation), for a total dosage of 0.18 mg; Visit 2: Treatment A: Two (2) inhalations of Primatene Mist (0.125 mg of epinephrine per inhalation), for a total dosage of 0.25 mg; Visit 3: Treatment B: Intramuscular injection of Epinephrine via Auto-Injector (0.30 mg of epinephrine solution in 0.30 mL), for a total dosage of 0.30 mg.

groups.title: All Study Participants
groups.description: All participants who have been randomized.

classes.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: C[Max], Maximum Plasma Concentration of Albuterol or Epinephrine
outcomeMeasures.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) blood samples will be collected starting 30 minutes before dose and until 24 hours after dose. Plasma will be isolated for analyzing the concentrations of Albuterol and Epinephrine. C\[max\] will be obtained directly from the plot of PK curve.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Per Protocol Population, defined as all subjects who have received all study medications and are evaluable for all treatments.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Samples were drawn at 30 minutes pre-dose and at 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 120 minutes, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, and 24 hours post-dose.

groups.title: Primatene Mist, E004
groups.description:
Participants who dosed with Primatene Mist.

Epinephrine (0.125 mg/inhalation): Participants will self-administer 2 inhalations of Epinephrine (0.125 mg/inhalation) for a total dosage of 0.25 mg.

groups.title: Epinephrine Injection Auto-Injector (Generic of EpiPen)
groups.description:
Participants who were dosed with an Epinephrine Injection Auto-Injector.

Epinephrine Injection Auto-Injector (0.3mg/0.3mL): Participants will receive an intramuscular injection of Epinephrine via Auto-Injector (0.30 mg of epinephrine solution in 0.30 mL). The 0.30 mL dose will be given perpendicularly as a single deep intramuscular injection into the anterolateral aspect of the thigh.

groups.title: Albuterol HFA
groups.description:
Participants who dosed with Albuterol HFA.

Albuterol Sulfate (0.09 mg/inhalation): Participants will self-administer 2 inhalations of Albuterol Sulfate (0.09 mg/inhalation) for a total dosage of 0.18 mg.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: From signing of consent until follow-up (approximately 4 weeks)

eventGroups.title: Primatene Mist, E004
eventGroups.description:

Epinephrine (0.125 mg/inhalation): Participants will self-administer 2 inhalations of Epinephrine (0.125 mg/inhalation) for a total dosage of 0.25 mg.
